chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order

result.execSummary:
The defendant Quinton Sterling Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

TIME SERVED DISPOSITION
Consecutive to: to any other sentence with credit for 114 days time served
Court advised the defendan that due to this domestic violence conviction, he may never possess a firearm or ammunition.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Transcript commencing 06-17-2014 Change of Plea received and filed.  Original transcript in case file 14CF1048 (20 Pages).

Defendant Quinton Sterling Peterson in court with attorney Amy Catherine Scholz.  Defendant Quinton Sterling Peterson in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 114 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 114 days time served.  THIS IS A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.  Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by the end of supervision in 14CF1048.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Court advised the defendant that due to this Domestic Violence conviction, he may never possess a firearms or ammunition.

Attorney Amy C Scholz in court, defendant Quinton Sterling Peterson not in court, in custody.  Michael C Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for sentencing.  Court is in trial and cannot hear the matter.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 11, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
from the defendant received and filed.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.   rmm

AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 3:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charges dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.
*
AS TO COUNT 1 AS AMENDED:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Statements made by Gladys L.  The 6/23/14 jury trial is vacated.

Defendant Quinton Sterling Peterson in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Defendant Quinton Sterling Peterson in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
AS TO COUNT 1:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered penalty enhancers Repeater and Domestic Abuse Repeater, dismissed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 1, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

signed and filed.  IT IS HEREBY ORDERED:  The petition is granted.  The defendant may be escorted by Milwaukee County Correction Officers or Sheriff's Deputies, observing such security precautions as the custodian determines (for example, correctional clothing and full restraints).
Petition and Order for Funeral Pass received. Forwarded to Br. 40 for consideration.
from the state received and filed.
from the state received and filed.

Defendant Quinton Sterling Peterson in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Defendant Quinton Sterling Peterson in custody.  Michael D Thurston for Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 6/23/14 in Branch 40.  State withdrew their offer to the defendant.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Defendant Quinton Sterling Peterson in court with attorney Amy Catherine Scholz.  Defendant Quinton Sterling Peterson in custody.  Molly Marie Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: City of Milwaukee Police Detective Mary Schmitz.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  
*
Scheduling Conference held.  On motion of the state, Court ordered 13CF5566, 14CF702 and 14CF1048 joined for the purpose of trial.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Due to defense counsel's scheduled, the 3/31/14 preliminary hearing is now set at 8:30 am.  rmm

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with GLADYS L.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Quinton Sterling Peterson in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Quinton Sterling Peterson in custody.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DALLET, Branch 40.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 40.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
